attributes.action: British Cycling to reconsider not backing a 4th day for Tour de Yorkshire.
attributes.background: On Monday 14th September, the board of British Cycling decided not to back plans to add a 4th day to the Tour de Yorkshire from 2016. With 1.2m spectators on the roadside in 2015 & an estimated £40m generated for the region, demand is clearly there. British cycling should reconsider their position.

rejection.details: You may wish to contact British Cycling directly to let them know of your concerns.
